message: Hi guys and gals. Bootstrapped http://quitjuice.com still hard at work with it but it went live tonight.
between my friends family and co-workers I already have plenty of people telling me why I should quit - why should I pay to hear more? (honest question)
If someone is interested in a discount code let me know.

@ZoFreX  lol. I totally feel you. I built this for myself. My story is in the about page. Point is that if you know you need to, but don't want to quit, digesting pros/cons/methods for quitting on a daily basis will eventually give you the "F*** It I'm quitting" you don't have in you now.

Maybe you should emphasise the fact you can buy it for others. I wouldn't buy it for myself, but my dad has been promising to quit since before I was born, your service might actually be annoying enough to make him quit :P
Does it work if someone else has bought it for you? Must be a big difference in mental approach to someone who wants to quit enough to pay out themselves?
yes you can buy it for someone else.

I'm a smoker and here's some feedback: Nothing in your website suggest me that this is a proven method. There's no doctors, not even a nurse, saying anything nice about this product. Also the colors are terrible, check any health-related website and you will see over and over white-blue-green, I'd suggest you don't innovate in this matter. On the marketing side, I'd me more confident if you have some sort of insurance over my money. Maybe if you don't quit smoking in X days we will give your money back, no questions asked. That would be nice.
@fceruti painful but that's the kind of feedback I'm looking for. Thanks very much.

@fceruti regarding doctors, have some meetings soon with medical docs to review our content. Trouble with "proven method" is that mHealth is brand spanking new and there is no conclusive data yet. Lots of interest and things are moving that direction. The few trials that have been done are positive though.
